item.title: Beth add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Beth add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Research is formalized curiosity. It is poking and prying with a purpose." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Beth add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "And in the end it is not the years in your life that count, it's the life in your years." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Beth add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Beth add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Beth add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Beth add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Beth add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Beth add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Beth add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Beth add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Beth add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts. There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature -- the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop away from you like the leaves of Autumn." -- John Muir

item.title: Beth add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Beth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Beth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Beth add a quote by Dan Millman
item.description: "There are no ordinary moments." -- Dan Millman

item.title: Beth add a quote by Martha Washington
item.description: "The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances." -- Martha Washington

item.title: Beth add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved -- loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Beth add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A loving heart is the truest wisdom." -- Charles Dickens
